title: Kath and Kim: the series. Eps 1-8 [DVD]
creator_credit: Mark Ruse, ABC-TV (Australia) and Ted Emery
brief_description: Originally aired on the ABC in 2002, this eight part slice-of-life comedy series gives an obvious nod to the reality show “Sylvania Waters”. Kath (Jane Turner), forty-something homeowner and fashion and fitness conscious woman, finds her lifestyle cramped when her spoilt only daughter, Kim (Gina Riley), returns home after leaving her husband, Brett (Peter Rowsthorn) - again. Kath has recently embarked on a passionate new relationship with butcher Kel (Glenn Robbins) and marriage is on the cards. Written and created by Gina Riley and Jane Turner. “Sex”: Kim arrives home unannounced and Kath does not intend slowing things down on the romance front, much to the disgust of her daughter. Kim enlists the help of second best friend Sharon (Magda Szubanski), to find the recipient of the black lingerie she located in Brett’s drawer. “Gay”: Brett professes his continued affection for Kim but she suspects he loves Rottweiler, Cujo, more. Meanwhile, Kath begins to suspect something sinister behind her daughter’s breakup. Kim and Sharon try speed dating. “Sport”: Eager to get back at the women with whom Brett did the dirty on her, Kim agrees to play in Sharon’s netball final against them. When Kim’s skills aren’t forthcoming, Kath steps in. “Fat”: It’s fitting time for the bridesmaids dresses and Kath is mortified to discover Kim won’t fit into the dress. She orders Kim to shed the kilos and Sharon contemplates a career in marriage counselling. “Old”: Kath’s exhausted by the solo wedding planning and Kim thinks her mum is showing her age. She becomes paranoid Kel thinks that too and is losing his desire for her. “Money”: Kath’s worrying about the down payment for her pumpkin style coach and is adamant she’s paying for everything herself. Kim’s spending money like its going out of fashion. She does help out however by modelling for Kath’s pyramid selling lingerie party. “Party”: Kim’s organising Kath’s hen’s night - the night she never had. Kel’s reluctant at having yet another buck’s night, but Kath manages to convince him otherwise. Everyone is guaranteed a night to remember - at least parts of it anyway. “The Wedding”: Kath and Kel’s fairytale wedding ends in disaster with most of the bridal party ending up in the hospital. Told in flashback, the episode is a fitting culmination to series one.
